newsitem.title: USA: A.R. Baron assets in three companies to be sold.
newsitem.headline: A.R. Baron assets in three companies to be sold.

text.p: Assets held by New York brokerage firm A.R. Baron and Co Inc in Jockey Club Inc, Innovir Laboratories Inc and Paperclip Imaging Software Inc will be liquidated.

In filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, 311,000 common shares in Jockey Club or 12 percent of the outstanding will be disposed of as well as 1,191,002 shares in Innovir or 19.9 percent of the outstanding.
In Paperclip, 2,727,902 shares or 32.5 percent of the outstanding will be sold, the filing said.
The liquidation is being carried out by James Giddens, who was appointed trustee by the bankruptcy court. A.R. Baron filed for bankruptcy protection in July after the SEC accused it of sales fraud.
The SEC ordered A.R. Baron to stop soliciting or carrying out security transactions for itself or its customers other than liquidating customer positions.
